trial_identification.studytitle: Dendritic cell vaccination trial for hormone refractory prostate cancer with autologous tumour as the antigen
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Dendritic cell vaccination trial for hormone refractory prostate cancer with autologous tumour as the antigen to assess safety and effect on disease progression.
trial_identification.secondaryid: Queensland Institute of Medical Research (QIMR): QIMR P647

interventions.interventions: Cultured autologous dendritic cells (DC) processed to present autologous prostate cancer antigens for treatment of hormone refractory prostate cancer. Vaccines are administered at 2 weekly intervals for 10 weeks and then 6-weekly for up to one year.
interventions.comparator: None, phase I, single arm study

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Every two weeks for 10 weeks and then every 6 weeks for up to 1 year

secondaryOutcome.outcome: PSA levels tested at each vaccination
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Every two weeks for 10 weeks and then every 6 weeks for up to 1 year.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Tumour stasis/regression assessed by radiography performed either.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At final assessment or as clinically indicated based on PSA levels.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Histologically proven prostatic Cancer, Maintenance hormone monotherapy, Serum PSA titres rising on 2 consecutive analyses, Minimum 5g of tumour-containing tissue.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: ECOG status >1, Significantly abnormal Haematological parameters, History of autoimmune disease or previous long-term use of immunosuppressive therapy, Positive serology for HIV, Hep C or B, Significant non-malignant disease, Psychiatric, addictive or any conditions which compromise ability to participate in trial.
